page.title: 08Our Churches
page.content: The name of Trysull church is All Saints.Our religion is Church of England. It is very old. Some parts are from the 11th century. It is made of sandstone and has a tower with a weather cock. This tells which way the wind is blowing.There is a sundial and a clock that chimes every hour.The church has very thick walls.Nearly all of the stones look old but some of the North wall are new. There are two entrances. One is the South door and the other the West.This door is new.Two old carvings are on the arch. They look like a king and queen.There are some stained glass windows in the church. The oldest one was made over 600 years ago.It is behind the altar.Over the vestry door is a carving of a bishop.You can see his mitre and crozier. It was carved in the 12th century.
